title: A Phase 1 Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single- and Multiple-ascending-dose Study of KHK6640 in Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of KHK6640, given as a single dose and as multiple doses in patients with Prodromal Alzheimer's Disease (AD) or Mild to Moderate AD.
drug: KHK6640 (humanized monoclonal antibody targeting amyloid-β oligomers)
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests KHK6640 for safety, tolerability and PK in prodromal / mild–moderate AD. Multiple sources describe KHK6640 as a humanized anti–amyloid-β oligomer-specific monoclonal antibody, i.e., a biologic that targets AD pathology rather than a small molecule or symptomatic cognitive/sbehavioral drug. citeturn0search2turn0search0

Act: Web searches confirm KHK6640 is an oligomer-specific antibody developed by Kyowa Hakko Kirin and was evaluated in Phase 1/1–2a trials (single- and multiple-ascending-dose, IV and SC) with biomarker and ARIA safety monitoring—consistent with disease-modifying immunotherapy. Clinical trial registry entries and reports (Phase 1 studies, Japanese and multinational cohorts) support this. citeturn0search4turn0search6turn0search7

Reflect: Given the mechanism (monoclonal antibody binding Aβ oligomers) and the trial focus on biomarkers, ARIA, PK and CSF/amyloid outcomes rather than solely symptomatic endpoints, the correct category is 'disease-targeted biologic'. This is not a small molecule, a general cognitive enhancer, or a neuropsychiatric-symptom intervention. citeturn0search2turn0search0
Web search results (key sources): PubMed article summarizing Phase 1/2a KHK6640 clinical data. citeturn0search2
Journal of Prevention of Alzheimer's Disease / Springer summary describing KHK6640 as a humanized anti‑Aβ oligomer‑specific antibody and trial outcomes. citeturn0search0
ALZFORUM coverage noting design and that KHK6640 is a modified IgG4 engineered to bind aggregated Aβ oligomers (reduced effector function to lower ARIA risk). citeturn0search7
ClinicalTrials / NCT entries for the single- and multiple-dose Phase 1 studies (Kyowa Hakko Kirin sponsorship, study start/completion dates). citeturn0search4turn0search6
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational product KHK6640 is described in the trial as a humanized monoclonal antibody that selectively binds aggregated/oligomeric forms of amyloid-β (Aβ), i.e., it directly targets Aβ pathology rather than symptomatic mechanisms. citeturn0search0turn0search1

Act: Extracted details from the trial description and supporting sources — KHK6640 (humanized anti–Aβ oligomer-specific monoclonal antibody); tested in Phase 1/1–2a single- and multiple-ascending-dose IV and SC studies with safety/PK, biomarker and ARIA monitoring — all consistent with an anti-amyloid biologic (disease-modifying immunotherapy). Based on that mechanism, assign to CADRO category A) Amyloid beta. citeturn0search0turn0search3turn0search5

Reflect: The CADRO categories map monoclonal antibodies that target amyloid species to A) Amyloid beta. The trial and publications specifically state oligomer-specific anti-Aβ activity and report biomarker/ARIA endpoints rather than only symptomatic outcomes, so A) Amyloid beta is the most specific and appropriate CADRO classification (not multi-target or non-therapeutic). citeturn0search0turn0search1
